intro: Hieracium lanatonargonense, commonly known as the Lanatonargon hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and sunny exposures. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium lanatonargonense is notable for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions and its role in local ecosystems.
